name: A.B. Quintanilla III
description:
'''Abraham Isaac Quintanilla III''' (born December 13, 1963), known professionally as '''A.B. Quintanilla III''' or '''A.B. Quintanilla''', is an American record producer, songwriter, and musician. Dubbed the "[[Honorific nicknames in popular music|King of Cumbia]]" for his influence on the [[cumbia]] music genre, he is the older brother of singer [[Selena]]. Quintanilla produced and co-wrote many of [[Selena albums discography|Selena's albums]] and [[Selena singles discography|singles]]. He is also the founder and creator of the bands [[Kumbia Kings]] and [[Kumbia All Starz]], for which he wrote and produced numerous hit songs and performed as a member of both groups. In addition, he has written, produced, and contributed music for various other artists.{{efn|group=upper-alpha|King of Kumbia is also spelled as King of Cumbia. Cumbia is the correct spelling of the music genre while Kumbia is the stylization used by A.B. Quintanilla III.}}

Alongside Selena, his sister [[Suzette Quintanilla]], and his father [[Abraham Quintanilla|Abraham Quintanilla Jr.]], he became a member of the family band [[Selena y Los Dinos|Los Dinos]] in 1980. As part of Los Dinos, Quintanilla played bass guitar and served as a producer and songwriter, helping create successful singles such as "[[Como la Flor]]", "[[Amor Prohibido (song)|Amor Prohibido]]", and "[[No Me Queda MÃ¡s]]". Following [[Murder of Selena|Selena's death]], he went on to form Kumbia Kings and later Kumbia All Starz.
